Package at.fhhagenberg.sqe.elevator.model

Interface IElevatorModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ElevatorModelImpl
    public interface IElevatorModel
    Interface which describes how objects describing an elevator model should look like.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  IElevatorModel.CommitedDirection
      Enum describing the commited direction.
      static class  IElevatorModel.DoorStatus
      Enum describing the current state of the elevators doors.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidCapacityException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid target value.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidFloorPositionException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid floor position.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidNumberException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid elevator number.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidPositionException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid elevator position.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidTargetException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid target value.
      static class  IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidWeightException
      Exception to be thrown when trying to set an invalid weight value.

    • Method Detail

      • createElevatorModel

        IElevatorModel createElevatorModel​(int personCapacity,
                                   int num,
                                   IBuildingModel b)
                            throws NullPointerException,
                                   IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidNumberException,
                                   IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidCapacityException
        Create instance of implementation class. Listeners of current object are assiged to returned object aswell.
        Parameters:
        personCapacity - Maximum capacity (in persons) this elevator can handle.
        b - Building this elevator is located in.
        Returns:
        Instance of implementation class.
        Throws:
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidCapacityException
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidNumberException
        NullPointerException

      • getNum

        int getNum()
        Returns:
        Number of this elevator.

      • getCommitedDirection

        IElevatorModel.CommitedDirection getCommitedDirection()
        Returns:
        The elevators commited direction.

      • setCommitedDirection

        void setCommitedDirection​(IElevatorModel.CommitedDirection d)
        Allows setting the commited direction of the elevator.
        Parameters:
        d - Action to set.

      • getAccel

        int getAccel()
        Returns:
        The elevators acceleration in feet per sec^2. alue is positive when accelerating and negative when decelerating.

      • setAccel

        void setAccel​(int a)
        Allows changing the elevators acceleration.
        Parameters:
        a - Acceleration to set (feet per sec^2.). Value is positive when accelerating and negative when decelerating.

      • getButtons

        SmartList<Boolean> getButtons()
        Returns:
        A ascending sorted list with all button states. (true if pressed, false otherwise)

      • getDoorStatus

        IElevatorModel.DoorStatus getDoorStatus()
        Returns:
        The current state of the elevators doors.

      • setDoorStatus

        void setDoorStatus​(IElevatorModel.DoorStatus d)
        Allows setting the state of the elevators doors.
        Parameters:
        d - New state to be set.

      • getFloorPos

        int getFloorPos()
        Returns:
        The current floor position this elevator is at.

      • setFloorPos

        void setFloorPos​(int p)
          throws IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidFloorPositionException
        Allows changing the floor position this elevator is at.
        Parameters:
        p - New floor position to set. (number between 0 and getFloorNum())
        Throws:
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidFloorPositionException

      • getSpeed

        int getSpeed()
        Returns:
        Current elevator speed in m/s. Positive speed indicates an upward movement, negative speed downward movement.

      • setSpeed

        void setSpeed​(int s)
        Allows setting the current elevator speed.
        Parameters:
        s - New speed in m/s. Positive speed indicates an upward movement, negative speed downward movement.

      • getWeight

        int getWeight()
        Returns:
        The weight this elevator is currently carrying (in lbs).

      • setWeight

        void setWeight​(int w)
        throws IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidWeightException
        Allows changing the weight this elevator is currently carrying.
        Parameters:
        w - New weight on the elevator in lbs.
        Throws:
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidWeightException

      • getTarget

        int getTarget()
        Returns:
        The floor currently targeted by the elevator (Future floorPos).

      • setTarget

        void setTarget​(int t)
        throws IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidTargetException
        Allows changing the floor target of this elevator.
        Parameters:
        p - New floor target to set. (number between 0 and getFloorNum())
        Throws:
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidTargetException

      • getCapacity

        int getCapacity()
        Returns:
        Maximum capacity (in persons) this elevator can handle.

      • setPos

        void setPos​(int p)
     throws IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidPositionException
        Sets elevator position in feet from the bottom of the building.
        Parameters:
        p - Elevator position in feet from the bottom of the building;
        Throws:
        IElevatorModel.ElevatorInvalidPositionException

      • getPos

        int getPos()
        Returns:
        Current elevator position in feet from the bottom of the building.

      • getAutomaticMode

        boolean getAutomaticMode()
        Returns:
        true if this elevator operates in automatic mode, false otherwise.

      • setAutomaticMode

        void setAutomaticMode​(boolean m)
        Allows setting the operation mode of this elevator.
        Parameters:
        m - true if this elevator should operate in automatic mode, false otherwise.

      • addAutomaticModePropertyChangeListener

        void addAutomaticModePropertyChangeListener​(PropertyChangeListener l)
        Allows adding a PropertyChangeListener which fires an event when the automatic mode property changes.
        Parameters:
        l - PropertyChangeListener to add.

      • removeAutomaticModePropertyChangeListener

        void removeAutomaticModePropertyChangeListener​(PropertyChangeListener l)
        Removes a formerly added automatic mode propertychangedlistener.
        Parameters:
        l - PropertyChangeListener to remove.

      • getNextTargetFloor

        int getNextTargetFloor()
        Returns:
        In automatic mode the number of the floor this elevator should navigate to. In manual mode the current floor position.
